meanings.definition: To act as the chairman of a meeting or organization.
meanings.sent1: Yesterday, John chairmaned the school assembly.
meanings.sent2: She chairmaned the board meeting with confidence.
meanings.sent3: The cat chairmaned the gathering of birds in the backyard.
meanings.sent4: The sun chairmaned the planets in their orbits.
meanings.sent5: The teacher chairmaned the classroom discussion with ease.

meanings.definition: Past tense of the verb 'chairman', meaning to have served as the chairman of a meeting or organization.
meanings.sent1: Last week, Sarah chairmaned the charity event successfully.
meanings.sent2: He chairmaned the conference last year.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel chairmaned the nut-sharing session in the park.
meanings.sent4: The moon chairmaned the tides of the ocean.
meanings.sent5: The mayor chairmaned the town hall meeting with grace.
